data.name: سُورَةُ الإِنسَانِ
data.englishBism: In the name of God, The Most Gracious, The Dispenser of Grace

ayahs.englishText: HAS THERE [not] been an endless span of time before man [appeared - a time] when he was not yet a thing to be thought of?
ayahs.arabicText: هَلْ أَتَىٰ عَلَى الْإِنْسَانِ حِينٌ مِنَ الدَّهْرِ لَمْ يَكُنْ شَيْئًا مَذْكُورًا

ayahs.englishText: Verily, it is We who have created man out of a drop of sperm intermingled, so that We might try him [in his later life]: and therefore We made him a being endowed with hearing and sight.
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّا خَلَقْنَا الْإِنْسَانَ مِنْ نُطْفَةٍ أَمْشَاجٍ نَبْتَلِيهِ فَجَعَلْنَاهُ سَمِيعًا بَصِيرًا

ayahs.englishText: Verily, We have shown him the way: [and it rests with him to prove himself] either grateful or ungrateful.
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّا هَدَيْنَاهُ السَّبِيلَ إِمَّا شَاكِرًا وَإِمَّا كَفُورًا

ayahs.englishText: [Now,] behold, for those who deny the truth We have readied chains and shackles, and a blazing flame
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّا أَعْتَدْنَا لِلْكَافِرِينَ سَلَاسِلَ وَأَغْلَالًا وَسَعِيرًا

ayahs.englishText: [whereas,] behold, the truly virtuous shall drink from a cup flavoured with the calyx of sweet-smelling flowers:
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ الْأَبْرَارَ يَشْرَبُونَ مِنْ كَأْسٍ كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا كَافُورًا

ayahs.englishText: a source [of bliss] whereof God's servants shall drink, seeing it flow in a flow abundant.
ayahs.arabicText: عَيْنًا يَشْرَبُ بِهَا عِبَادُ اللَّهِ يُفَجِّرُونَهَا تَفْجِيرًا

ayahs.englishText: [The truly virtuous are] they [who] fulfil their vows, and stand in awe of a Day the woe of which is bound to spread far and wide,
ayahs.arabicText: يُوفُونَ بِالنَّذْرِ وَيَخَافُونَ يَوْمًا كَانَ شَرُّهُ مُسْتَطِيرًا

ayahs.englishText: and who give food - however great be their own want of it - unto the needy, and the orphan, and the captive,
ayahs.arabicText: وَيُطْعِمُونَ الطَّعَامَ عَلَىٰ حُبِّهِ مِسْكِينًا وَيَتِيمًا وَأَسِيرًا

ayahs.englishText: [saying, in their hearts,] "We feed you for the sake of God alone: we desire no recompense from you, nor thanks:
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّمَا نُطْعِمُكُمْ لِوَجْهِ اللَّهِ لَا نُرِيدُ مِنْكُمْ جَزَاءً وَلَا شُكُورًا

ayahs.englishText: behold, we stand in awe of our Sustainer's judgment on a distressful, fateful Day!"
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّا نَخَافُ مِنْ رَبِّنَا يَوْمًا عَبُوسًا قَمْطَرِيرًا

ayahs.englishText: And so, God will preserve them from the woes of that Day, and will bestow on them brightness and joy,
ayahs.arabicText: فَوَقَاهُمُ اللَّهُ شَرَّ ذَٰلِكَ الْيَوْمِ وَلَقَّاهُمْ نَضْرَةً وَسُرُورًا

ayahs.englishText: and will reward them for all their patience in adversity with a garden [of bliss] and with [garments of] silk.
ayahs.arabicText: وَجَزَاهُمْ بِمَا صَبَرُوا جَنَّةً وَحَرِيرًا

ayahs.englishText: In that [garden] they will on couches recline, and will know therein neither [burning] sun nor cold severe,
ayahs.arabicText: مُتَّكِئِينَ فِيهَا عَلَى الْأَرَائِكِ ۖ لَا يَرَوْنَ فِيهَا شَمْسًا وَلَا زَمْهَرِيرًا

ayahs.englishText: since its [blissful] shades will come down low over them, and low will hang down its clusters of fruit, most easy to reach.
ayahs.arabicText: وَدَانِيَةً عَلَيْهِمْ ظِلَالُهَا وَذُلِّلَتْ قُطُوفُهَا تَذْلِيلًا

ayahs.englishText: And they will be waited upon with vessels of silver and goblets that will [seem to] be crystal –
ayahs.arabicText: وَيُطَافُ عَلَيْهِمْ بِآنِيَةٍ مِنْ فِضَّةٍ وَأَكْوَابٍ كَانَتْ قَوَارِيرَا

ayahs.englishText: crystal-like, [but] of silver - the measure whereof they alone will determine.
ayahs.arabicText: قَوَارِيرَ مِنْ فِضَّةٍ قَدَّرُوهَا تَقْدِيرًا

ayahs.englishText: And in that [paradise] they will be given to drink of a cup flavoured with ginger,
ayahs.arabicText: وَيُسْقَوْنَ فِيهَا كَأْسًا كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا زَنْجَبِيلًا

ayahs.englishText: [derived from] a source [to be found] therein, whose name is "Seek Thy Way".
ayahs.arabicText: عَيْنًا فِيهَا تُسَمَّىٰ سَلْسَبِيلًا

ayahs.englishText: And immortal youths will wait upon them: when thou seest them, thou wouldst deem them to be scattered pearls;
ayahs.arabicText: ۞ وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ وِلْدَانٌ مُخَلَّدُونَ إِذَا رَأَيْتَهُمْ حَسِبْتَهُمْ لُؤْلُؤًا مَنْثُورًا

ayahs.englishText: and when thou seest [anything that is] there thou wilt see [only] bliss and a realm transcendent
ayahs.arabicText: وَإِذَا رَأَيْتَ ثَمَّ رَأَيْتَ نَعِيمًا وَمُلْكًا كَبِيرًا

ayahs.englishText: Upon those [blest] will be garments of green silk and brocade; and they will be adorned with bracelets of silver. And their Sustainer will them to drink of a drink most pure.
ayahs.arabicText: عَالِيَهُمْ ثِيَابُ سُنْدُسٍ خُضْرٌ وَإِسْتَبْرَقٌ ۖ وَحُلُّوا أَسَاوِرَ مِنْ فِضَّةٍ وَسَقَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ شَرَابًا طَهُورًا

ayahs.englishText: [And they will be told:] "Verily, all this is your reward since Your endeavour [in life] has met [God's] goodly acceptance!"
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ هَٰذَا كَانَ لَكُمْ جَزَاءً وَكَانَ سَعْيُكُمْ مَشْكُورًا

ayahs.englishText: VERILY, [O believer,] it is We who have bestowed from on high this Qur’an upon thee, step by step - truly a bestowal from on high!
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نَزَّلْنَا عَلَيْكَ الْقُرْآنَ تَنْزِيلًا

ayahs.englishText: Await, then, in all patience thy Sustainer's judgment, and pay no heed to any of them, who is a wilful sinner or an ingrate;
ayahs.arabicText: فَاصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تُطِعْ مِنْهُمْ آثِمًا أَوْ كَفُورًا

ayahs.englishText: and bear in mind thy Sustainer's name at morn and evening
ayahs.arabicText: وَاذْكُرِ اسْمَ رَبِّكَ بُكْرَةً وَأَصِيلًا

ayahs.englishText: and during some of the night, and prostrate thyself before Him, and extol His limitless glory throughout the long night.
ayahs.arabicText: وَمِنَ اللَّيْلِ فَاسْجُدْ لَهُ وَسَبِّحْهُ لَيْلًا طَوِيلًا

ayahs.englishText: Behold, they [who are unmindful of God] love this fleeting life, and leave behind them [all thought of] a grief-laden Day.
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ هَٰؤُلَاءِ يُحِبُّونَ الْعَاجِلَةَ وَيَذَرُونَ وَرَاءَهُمْ يَوْمًا ثَقِيلًا

ayahs.englishText: [They will not admit to themselves that] it We who have created them and strengthened their make - and [that] if it be Our will We can replace them entirely with others of their kind.
ayahs.arabicText: نَحْنُ خَلَقْنَاهُمْ وَشَدَدْنَا أَسْرَهُمْ ۖ وَإِذَا شِئْنَا بَدَّلْنَا أَمْثَالَهُمْ تَبْدِيلًا

ayahs.englishText: VERILY, all this is an admonition: whoever, then, so wills, may unto his Sustainer find a way.
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِ تَذْكِرَةٌ ۖ فَمَنْ شَاءَ اتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِ سَبِيلًا

ayahs.englishText: But you cannot will it unless God wills [to show you that way]: for, behold, God is indeed all-seeing, wise.
ayahs.arabicText: وَمَا تَشَاءُونَ إِلَّا أَنْ يَشَاءَ اللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ كَانَ عَلِيمًا حَكِيمًا

ayahs.englishText: He admits unto His grace everyone who wills [to be admitted]; but as for the evildoers - for them has He readied grievous suffering [in the life to come].
ayahs.arabicText: يُدْخِلُ مَنْ يَشَاءُ فِي رَحْمَتِهِ ۚ وَالظَّالِمِينَ أَعَدَّ لَهُمْ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًا
